title: Human papillomavirus simulator (HPVsim)
text: HPVsim is a flexible agent-based model for simulation HPV transmission and progression through cervical disease to cancer. The model can be parameterized with country-specific vital dynamics, structured sexual networks, co-transmitting HPV genotypes, B- and T-cell mediated immunity, and high-resolution disease natural history. HPVsim is designed with a user-first lens: it is implemented in pure Python, has built-in tools for simulating commonly-used interventions, has been extensively tested and documented, and runs in a matter of seconds to minutes on a laptop.

title: Human papillomavirus simulator (HPVsim)
text:
Versions
In mid-2025, version 3.0 of HPVsim will be released, built on the Starsim modeling architecture. Since this represents a significant shift, version 3.0 and above will live in a separate repository. The code in this repository will be frozen after version 2.2, aside from any critical bugfixes.

title: Human papillomavirus simulator (HPVsim)
text:
Publications
The scientific paper describing HPVsim is available at https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1012181. The recommended citation is:
Stuart RM, Cohen JA, Kerr CC, Mathur P, NDMC India, Zimmermann M, Rao DW, Boudreau MC, Lee S, Yang L, Klein DJ (2024). HPVsim: An agent-based model of HPV transmission and cervical disease. PLOS Computational Biology, 20(7), e1012181. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1012181
Academic papers that have been written using HPVsim include:

Inferring the natural history of HPV from global cancer registries: insights from a multi-country calibration (2024). Stuart RM, Cohen JA, Abeysuriya RG, Sanz-Leon P, Kerr CC, Rao DW, Klein DJ. Sci Rep 14, 15875. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-024-65842-3
HPV DNA Screening and Vaccination Strategies in Tunisia (2025). Lahdhiri A, Benzina B, Ennaifer E, Tounsi H, Gzara A, Rammeh-Rommani S, Laraj O, Arfaoui H, Stuart RM Kebir, A, BenMiled S (2025). Sci Rep, forthcoming.
Can pruning improve agent-based modelsâ€™ calibration? An application to HPVsim (2025). Sturman F, Swallow B, Kerr CC, Stuart RM, Panovska-Griffiths J. Journal of Theoretical Biology, forthcoming.
